required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Multicenter Study to Evaluate Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of JBT-101 in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (ALE09)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of JBT-101 (also known as lenabasum) in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
- One hundred adults with active joint disease and at least moderate pain will be enrolled in this study to evaluate treatment of their systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with JBT-101. JBT-101 is a synthetic endocannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist and an activator of the body's normal processes, to resolve innate immune responses without immunosuppression.
- Participants will receive 2 doses of JBT-101 by mouth (three groups of varying doses) or, placebo, for 84 days and will continue to be followed for an additional 28 days. Participant visits to assess endpoints occur on Day 1, then every 2 weeks twice, then every 4 weeks three times, for a total of six visits.
- The change in maximum daily pain Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) score from Baseline (Visit 1) will be assessed at every visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the 7-Day Average of the Maximum Daily NRS-Pain Score at Day 84
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Day 84 (Visit 5, Last Day of Treatment)
primary_outcome.description: The numeric rating scale for pain (NRS-Pain) consists of an 11-point NRS ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (pain as bad as you can imagine). A rating of 1-3 is considered mild pain; 4-6, moderate pain; and 7-10, severe pain. Participants will be asked to report their maximum daily pain using the NRS-Pain. Participants will call into an interactive voice response e diary system (IVRS) and record the number that best reflects their maximum amount of pain experienced in the last 24 hours. Participants will be asked to call at the same time each day, preferably before bedtime. Baseline: Pre-treatment; Day 84: Last Day (Visit 5) of a 12-week course of assigned treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the 7-day Average of the Maximum NRS-Pain Score Prior to Study Visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric rating scale for pain (NRS-Pain) consists of an 11-point NRS ranging from 0 (no pain) to 10 (pain as bad as you can imagine). A rating of 1-3 is considered mild pain; 4-6, moderate pain; and 7-10, severe pain. The percent change in the 7-day average of the maximum NRS-Pain scores prior to study Visit 1 (Baseline), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84) and Visit 6 (Day 112) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Active Lupus Musculoskeletal Disease Activity - BILAG-2004
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) musculoskeletal disease activity over time will be assessed based on the musculoskeletal domain of the British Isles Lupus Activity Group (BILAG) 2004.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Lupus Disease Activity - SELENA-SLEDAI Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active lupus activity over time will be assessed based on the SELENA SLEDAI score. The Safety of Estrogen in Lupus National Assessment (SELENA) Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI) is a validated tool for assessing SLE disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Lupus Disease Activity - Total BILAG-2004 Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active lupus over time will be evaluated based on the total BILAG-2004 score. The BILAG-2004* is a validated index for assessing SLE disease activity. The BILAG-2004 includes 97 clinical and laboratory items to evaluate SLE disease activity in 9 organ systems. * BILAG-2004: British Isles Lupus Assessment Group 2004.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Lupus Disease Activity -Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active lupus over time will be based on the total PGA score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Lupus Disease Activity- Patient Global Assessment Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active lupus over time will be based on the total Patient Global Assessment score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in State of Health- PROMIS-29 Short Form Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS)-29 Short Form (Version 2.0) will be used to assess trends over time in this state of health measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in State of Health -PROMIS-Applied Cognition General Concerns Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)]
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Applied Cognition General Concerns (Version 1.0) scale will be used to assess trends over time in this health measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Satisfaction After Twelve Weeks of Assigned Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: At the end of 12 weeks of treatment, the participant and their physician will complete separately a survey asking what treatment assignment they believe they received (e.g., JBT-101, placebo, or cannot tell), whether the participant received benefit from their assigned treatment and whether the participant or their physician would choose the treatment received.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Grade 3 or Higher Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAS) During Treatment Phase of Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 after initiation of study intervention through Day 112
secondary_outcome.description: The number of TEAS will be identified by monitoring participant-reported AEs, vital signs, medical history, physical exams, blood and urine safety tests, 12-lead electrocardiograms, and the Addiction Research Center Inventory-Marijuana (ARCI-M). TEAS are defined as AEs that, in the opinion of the blinded/masked site investigator, are " possibly", "probably" or "definitely" related to the assigned study treatment. Unless noted otherwise, grading will be defined by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) - Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), version 4.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Disease Activity Using the SLE Responder Index (SRI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: (Baseline, Day 1-prior to treatment initiation), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) disease activity over time will be assessed using the SRI. The SRI is a validated SLE disease activity instrument used to detect clinically meaningful improvement of disease in SLE clinical trials. The SRI is a composite instrument comprised of the SELENA-SLE Disease Activity Index [SELENA-SLEDAI], Physician Global Assessment (PGA) and British Isles Lupus Assessment Group (BILAG) 2004.

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Disease Flares by Severity Using the SELENA-SLEDAI Flare Index (SFI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, (Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: The SFI instrument will be used to define disease flare(s) and severity over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Active Musculoskeletal Disease Defined by the Presence or Absence of Arthritis Using the SELENA-SLEDAI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1-prior to treatment initiation), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: The validated SELENA-SLEDAI* tool will be used to assess trends over time in active musculoskeletal disease activity based on presence or absence of arthritis. * Safety of Estrogens in Lupus Erythematosus:National Assessment Version of the Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index [SELENA-SLEDAI]

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Swollen Joint Count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, (Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active musculoskeletal disease activity over time will be assessed using the physician-assessed swollen joint count assessments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Tender Joint Count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, (Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 4 (Day 56), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
secondary_outcome.description: Trends in active musculoskeletal disease activity over time will be assessed using the physician-assessed tender joint count assessments.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Disease Activity Using C-Reactive Protein
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
other_outcome.description: Serum C-reactive protein (CRP) will be used as a biomarker of active SLE disease-associated inflammation.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Pro-Inflammatory Cytokine Levels
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
other_outcome.description: Trends in pro-inflammatory serum cytokines over time (e.g., IFN alpha, IFN gamma, IL-6, TNF alpha, IL-1beta, etc.) will be assessed by ELISA assay.

other_outcome.measure: Change in pro-inflammatory cytokine expression in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) pre- and post-TLR stimulation
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
other_outcome.description: Trends in pro-inflammatory cytokines over time will be evaluated by in vitro assays prior to and after toll-like receptor (TLR) stimulation using CpG and Gardiquimod.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Type 1 IFN Gene Expression Signature
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 3 (Day 28), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
other_outcome.description: Trends in the presence of Type 1 interferon (IFN) alpha gene expression over time using total RNA from whole blood will be evaluated.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Plasma Metabolipidomic Profile
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 2 (Day 14), Visit 3 (Day 28) and Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Trends in levels of bioactive lipids (e.g., lipoxin A4, anti- and pro-inflammatory eicosanoids, etc.) in plasma over time will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in JBT-101 Plasma Concentrations
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 2 (Day 14), Visit 3 (Day 28) and Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Trends in JBT-101 plasma concentrations over time will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in JBT-101 Metabolites
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 2 (Day 14), Visit 3 (Day 28) and Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment)
other_outcome.description: Trends in the presence of JBT-101 metabolites over time will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: EXPLORATORY: Change from Baseline in Participant Fibromyalgia Symptom Score
other_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1 (Baseline, Day 1), Visit 5 (Day 84 - Last Day of Treatment) and Visit 6 (Day 112)
other_outcome.description: The presence and severity of fibromyalgia will be assessed over time using the Fibromyalgia Symptom Scale instrument.

arm_group.description: Eligible subjects will receive assigned study treatment of JBT-101 5 mg administered twice daily.
Eligible subjects will receive assigned study treatment of JBT-101 20 mg (A.M. Study Product) and 20 mg Placebo (P.M. Study Product).
Eligible subjects will receive assigned study treatment of JBT-101 20 mg (A.M. Study Product) and JBT-101 20 mg (P.M. Study Product).
Eligible subjects will receive assigned study treatment of Placebo (A.M.) and Placebo (P.M.) for (JBT-101).

intervention.description: Participants will self-administer JBT-101 by mouth (orally), at prescribed dose and frequency per protocol, Days 1-84. Administration of dose(s) should be at least 8 hours apart.
Participants will self-administer JBT-101 placebo by mouth (orally), at prescribed dose and frequency per protocol, Days 1-84. Administration of dose(s) should be at least 8 hours apart.

patient_data.ipd_description: The plan is to share data in ImmPort [https://immport.niaid.nih.gov/ ], a long-term archive of clinical and mechanistic data from DAIT-funded grants and contracts, upon completion of the study.
